titles.title: Foreign Tax Credit Revenue Enhancement Act of 2002

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the foreign tax credit not be redetermined with respect to refunds of unlawful foreign taxes to taxpayers who successfully challenge those taxes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 11/14/2002--Introduced. Foreign Tax Credit Revenue Enhancement Act of 2002 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to state that refunded accrued taxes relating to the foreign tax credit don't need to be redetermined by the Secretary of the Treasury if the refund was a result of a court determination that the imposed tax is unlawful.
